body:
I think this enhancement is _a kind of_ dup of  #2954 

(I was looking for [general purpose constants](https://github.com/sass/sass/issues/3398) but found yours and the suggested dup instead)

They're differentâ€”https://github.com/sass/sass/issues/2954 would add support for `math.$infinity`, `math.$negative-infinity`, and `math.$nan` (`math.$pi` and `math.$e` already exist). This would add support for `calc(infinity)`, `calc(-infinity)`, `calc(NaN)`, `calc(pi)`, and `calc(e)`.

According to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/calc-constant#browser_compatibility, all of these constants are now supported by Firefox (although interestingly it seems _none_ are supported in Chrome).

labels.name: blocked
labels.description: Waiting on another issue to be fixed

body: The proposal has landed. Since it's relatively unlikely to be controversial, I'll give it two weeks for public comment before declaring it implementable.

issue.title: Add support for constants in calculations

issue.title: [Calc Constants] Merge into the canonical spec
